page.title: 06THE HISTORY OF"THE PADDOCK"
page.content: MY HOUSE WAS BUILT BY A LOCAL FIRM ABOUT 49 YEARS AGO.THE JOINERY FIRM WERE CALLED BELL AND WILSON .THEY BUILT THE HOUSE FOR MR HOUGHTON.HE WAS MR DAN HOUGHTON'S FATHER .BEFORE THE HOUSE WAS BUILT THE SITE WAS A PARKING AREA FOR MR HOUGHTON'S STEAM DRIVEN TRACTOR ENGINES AND THRESHING MACHINES.THE HOUSE IS BUILT ON A TWENTY INCH THICK LIMESTONE WALL FOUNDATION.THE REST OF THE WALLS ARE BUILT OF RED CLAY BRICKS MADE AT CLAUGHTON MANOR BRICK WORKS NEAR LANCASTER.IT HAS A BURLINGTON SLATE ROOF.MY DAD HAS MADE QUITE A FEW CHANGES SINCE HE BOUGHT IT IN 1972 INCLUDING PUTTING IN A STAIRCASE AND MAKING THE ATTIC INTO TWO ROOMS,ONE OF WHICH IS MY BEDROOM.
